section.title: Transitions and Effects
section.para: The photos in a PhotoPulse show are displayed using a series of transitions and effects. A Transition defines how one photo transitions out from the previous photo and into the next photo in the show. The transitions for two adjacent photos will overlap in time (play simultaneously during the transition period). An Effect defines how an individual photo is displayed. Each photo has a beginning transition, an effect and an ending transition.

For example, photo A has a falling leaves effect and a fade out ending transition. Photo B has a falling snowflake effect and a fade in beginning transition. In this case, photo A is displayed with the falling leaves effect until the transition period. At that time it begins to fade out while at the same time photo B begins to fade in while displaying the falling snowflake effect. When the transition period is over, photo A has faded to invisibility and photo B is now fully opaque and is continuing to display its falling snowflake effect.
The Transitions In Tab, Effects Tab and Transitions Out Tab can be used to select the set of transitions and effects that will be chosen when creating a show. See for more information.

section.title: Transitions and Effects Tabs
section.para: The Transitions and Effects Tabs contain scrolling lists of checkboxes, enabling you to choose your preferred transitions and effects. The transitions and effects that are checked are the ones that will be used when automatically applying transitions and effects.

listitem.para: Check the checkboxes of your preferred beginning transitions (the transition that plays as a new photo transitions onscreen).
Check the checkboxes of your preferred effects (the effect plays the entire time the photo is onscreen).
Check the checkboxes of your preferred ending transitions (the transition that plays as an existing photo transitions offscreen).
